title: How to Burn the Edges of a Piece of Paper

steps.title: Wet the corner of a piece of paper.
steps.content: Wet the corner of a piece of paper. Dip the bottom corner of the paper into a cup of water or pour a small amount onto the piece of paper. Spread the water gently with your fingers so the paper doesn’t get too oversaturated or rip. [1] X Research source Wetting the corner will let you safely burn the paper without the rest of the sheet catching aflame.

steps.title: Hold the end of a utility lighter underneath the wet corner for 10 seconds.
steps.content: Hold the end of a utility lighter underneath the wet corner for 10 seconds. Ignite the lighter by pushing forward on the top button and squeezing the trigger. Once it’s lit, move the tip of the lighter under the paper so the flame is barely touching the paper. Keep it there to darken the paper and safely burn it without the sheet catching on fire. [2] X Research source You can use a small lighter, but it won’t give you as much control over the flame. Use caution with an open flame and ask a parent for help if you’re younger.

steps.title: Keep the paper over the flame longer to burn holes.
steps.content: Keep the paper over the flame longer to burn holes. Hold the flame under the paper until you see it form a hole in the corner or burn through the edge completely. Flip the paper over occasionally to check on the color of the other side. [3] X Research source The soot that forms on the other side can be scratched off with a fingernail, so be careful when handling it.

steps.title: Let the corner dry completely before wetting a different edge.
steps.content: Let the corner dry completely before wetting a different edge. Let the paper sit in a warm, dry spot for 10 minutes before moving on. If the paper gets too wet throughout, it will be flimsy and difficult to work with later on. Repeat the process as many times as you need until your paper looks the way you want. [4] X Research source Use a fan or a blow dryer to speed up the drying process.

steps.title: Hold the edge of the paper over the flame until it singes.
steps.content: Hold the edge of the paper over the flame until it singes. Light the tealight with a lighter and let it burn until the flame settles. Hold the paper on the side opposite of the one you’re planning to burn. Hold a dry tea towel in your other hand. Keep a small part of the paper’s edge over the flame and pull it away once you see the paper turn orange and start to burn. [5] X Research source Be careful not to burn your fingers if you’re singeing the edges of a smaller piece of paper.

steps.title: Wipe the burning edge immediately with a clean tea towel.
steps.content: Wipe the burning edge immediately with a clean tea towel. After you pull the paper away from the flame, set it down on a large ceramic plate and wipe it away from the center of the page so the soot doesn’t smudge. Apply a firm pressure to extinguish the flame. The edge of the paper will now have a black char mark on it. [6] X Research source Bunch the towel up in your hand so the heat doesn’t transfer to your fingers when you wipe. Be sure to extinguish the flame right away, or else you'll burn your whole paper up.

steps.title: Work your way around the edge of the paper.
steps.content: Work your way around the edge of the paper. Singe the paper in small sections no larger than 1 to 2 in (2.5 to 5.1 cm) at a time. Always wipe away from the middle of the piece of paper so it doesn’t smudge. This will help you control the burn so the whole sheet doesn’t burn. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tear the edges of the paper with your hands to your desired shape.
steps.content: Tear the edges of the paper with your hands to your desired shape. Hold the edges of the paper between your thumb and index finger with each hand. Use short tears and keep your fingers near the ripped edge so you don’t lose control of which direction the tear goes. [8] X Research source Make your rips oddly-shaped so it doesn’t look uniform. Fire acts unpredictably, so the edge should be random. Look at pictures of burnt paper for ideas on what shape to make your paper.

steps.title: Paint the edges with a small amount of lemon juice.
steps.content: Paint the edges with a small amount of lemon juice. Put a small amount of lemon juice in a bowl and dip either a sponge or paintbrush into it. Dab the torn edge of the paper with the lemon juice so it is slightly damp, but not oversaturated. [9] X Research source Hold the paintbrush just above the paper and flick the bristles to create a splatter effect on your paper. This will make smaller dots of color appear later.

steps.title: Hold a blow dryer 1 in (2.5 cm) away from the paper to dry it.
steps.content: Hold a blow dryer 1 in (2.5 cm) away from the paper to dry it. Set the blow dryer to the hot setting and hold it just above the paper. Hold the paper with your other hand or weight it down. Focus the hot air around the edges you painted. As the lemon juice heats up, the paper will start to brown. [10] X Research source The heat reacts with the acid in the lemon juice causing the discoloration on the paper. The same effect can be used to write in invisible ink . [11] X Research source

steps.title: Brown the paper until you’re happy with the color.
steps.content: Brown the paper until you’re happy with the color. Apply more lemon juice to the piece of paper to make a darker color. Paint the area just near the tear to resemble a charred edge. Continue to heat the paper to make the color set. [12] X Research source
